title: The Strategic Pursuits of Walter Butler
summary: Walter Butler discovers he can organize time itself, which he uses to prevent a disaster and learn about the true value of meticulous planning.
summaryGerman: Walter Butler entdeckt, dass er die Zeit selbst organisieren kann, was er nutzt, um eine Katastrophe zu verhindern und den wahren Wert akribischer Planung zu lernen.
summaryDutch: Walter Butler ontdekt dat hij zelf tijd kan organiseren, wat hij gebruikt om een ramp te voorkomen en de ware waarde van nauwkeurige planning te leren.
summaryFrench: Walter Butler découvre qu'il peut organiser le temps lui-même, qu'il utilise pour éviter un désastre et apprendre la vraie valeur de la planification minutieuse.

story.text: Walter Butler, a 27-year-old organizing consultant, wakes up to find that his ability to structure and strategize extends beyond his job - he can organize time. Realizing this power, he saves a falling toddler using his newly discovered skills.
As Walter experiments with his power, he accidentally stretches a minute into an hour, making his morning jog last frustratingly long. He decides to better understand and control this ability.
Walter begins using his power to optimize his daily activities, finding joy in perfectly aligning his schedule with absolute precision.
Noticing increased stress from his non-stop optimized schedule, Walter feels isolated. He seeks advice from a wise elder who suggests that not everything in life should be controlled.
Walter uses his powers to facilitate a large community event. His flawless timing ensures it’s a massive success, bringing the community closer together.
During a romantic dinner, Walter resists the urge to control time, instead embracing the unpredictable moments that make life special.
A storm threatens a local festival. Walter, mastering his powers, coordinates the community’s efforts in real time, averting a crisis and earning the town’s admiration.

ending: Thus, Walter Butler learned that while time can be mastered, the true master appreciates both the orderly and the unexpected moments of life.
moral: Control is useful, but the uncontrollable can bring its own joys.
